revision.text: {{ArticleHistory | action1 = GAN | action1date = 07:21, 29 December 2010 (UTC) | action1link = talk:Oxaziridine/GA1 | action1result = listed | action1oldid = 404781562 | action2 = GAR | action2date = 01:25, 23 April 2013 (UTC) | action2link = talk:Oxaziridine/GA2 | action2result = kept | action2oldid = 551725392 | topic = chemistry | dykdate = 14 December 2010 | dykentry = ... that an '''[[oxaziridine]]''' [[rearrangement reaction]] is the key step in the synthesis of [[erectile dysfunction]] medication [[yohimbine]]? | currentstatus = GA }} {{chemistry|class=GA|importance=low}} {{Talk:Oxaziridine/GA1}} == GA status == The original lead was converted into a history section, which now contains more than history. Now the lead is too short and fails [[WP:Lead]], part of the Good article criteria. I though about reverting, but then there will be information in the lead not covered in the article. I don't have the skills to fix this myself and the original contributor hasn't edited for a while so I am hoping someone is watching this who can fix it. [[User:Aircorn|AIR'''''corn''''']] [[User talk:Aircorn|(talk)]] 05:46, 22 October 2012 (UTC) Aircorn, just saw this note after having reverted it in response to the revision discussion page. I now see what you mean about there being info in the lead that's not in the main article. I think it's pretty good as is. If you let me know specifically what you think should be changed, I could address that. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:DMelvinKaphan|DMelvinKaphan]] ([[User talk:DMelvinKaphan|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/DMelvinKaphan|contribs]]) 18:39, 3 April 2013 (UTC)
